narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Katherine Jane Young  N/A - Kata was the TA for stands, not fire.
Instructor: Katherine Jane Young  N/A

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Thanks for a great semester Ann! You will be missed

To answer #15 in more detail (how valuable) - I think this course is critical for F&ES students interested in land, ecosystem or forest management, particularly in the western US (but everywhere). Fires are only going to increase in frequency and severity with climate change and this course is indispensable for knowing about fire ecology and fire management. This course needs to continue to be offered!!!
Ann was great. It's always fun to learn from her.
Ann will be sorely missed. This was a great class where I learned a lot from my peers and got to practice my presenting skills. We love you Ann! Best of luck.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: I liked the combination of ecology, policy, management, etc. There are a TON of issues that relate to fire, and this class did a good job of exposing us to each of them, and letting us dive into ones that interested us more

Learning about fire ecology, fire management, and fire policy; guest speakers; presentations to explore specific topics of interest in further depth; learning from Ann - someone who has worked on fire in the USFS for so many years

The presentations in this course helped me grow as a presenter , at the same time, preparing for these presentations helps you to delve into a topic that you personally care about. Other presentations made by the classmates can teach you so much.
Learning from each other

Since the course material was fairly broad, the multiple presentations allowed for students to explore the particular topics that interested them the most. Also, I thought there was an appropriate number of guest speakers to cover a few different topics that needed specialized expertise without becoming a class that relied entirely on guest speakers thus becoming disjointed.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Keep this course around
None.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Fire is a critical component of forestry, no matter where you are working. Having this exposure to all of the different topics related to fire will allow me to better manage forests, and think about how fire relates to policy.

I am focused on land conservation and management in the American West, where fire is not only a natural part of the ecosystem but plays an increasingly important role in management and policy decisions.
Fire as a management tool will help me and my fellow future colleagues to better management forests and grassland.
Essential course for anyone interested in public land issues like me.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Because Ann was teaching it, and because I didn't know anything about fire and thought that, as a forester, I should know something about it...
To learn more about the ecology of fire and how fire influences management and policy decisions.
The climate is getting drier and drier in my home place, thus, fire events are becoming more regular than before. Thus, knowing fire ecology would help me to better manage the environment back home.
For Ann
To understand the role of climate change on wildfire.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, though I wish we had touched more on ecology/silviculture/etc.
Yes - I now have concrete knowledge about fire ecology and understand some of the complexities of land management in fire prone ecosystems.
Yes. It did meet my expectations.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: N/A
Getting to know others, learning how to present together

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Request that this course be offered again, find someone qualified to teach it, and take it!

Fire Science is great course weather you are into management or science. Fire is something that we should never ignore. If you don't know fire, then you are missing a very important ingredient in the pie.
Find your presentation topics early, and spend a good bit of time on them throughout the semester.
